text_Original: From the perspective of medical care for disabled populations and public health, this technology has been on my radar for some time. For those bedbound, homebound, or otherwise estranged from friends and family, this will be transformative. Millions no longer able to travel, for instance, will rejoin loved ones virtually as an avatar. Imagine the benefits both emotionally, and socioeconomically, for the severely disabled who will visit their office virtually, take part in conferences, produce meaningful work, socialize with friends. They will regain self-sufficiency and dignity.
text_Display: From the perspective of medical care for disabled populations and public health, this technology has been on my radar for some time. For those bedbound, homebound, or otherwise estranged from friends and family, this will be transformative. Millions no longer able to travel, for instance, will rejoin loved ones virtually as an avatar. Imagine the benefits both emotionally, and socioeconomically, for the severely disabled who will visit their office virtually, take part in conferences, produce meaningful work, socialize with friends. They will regain self-sufficiency and dignity.

text_Original: This is a scenario to be cautiously optimistic about. It might be used for good, but could also used for evil. This could be highly addictive, and people with low self esteem would probably rush to use this as a replacement for actual human contact. Put two and two together and some in between, we find ourselves in a dystopic society almost like Blade Runner… Although it’s really cool and an absolutely mindblowing technology, it’s also something to be seen as a threat to real human connection.
text_Display: This is a scenario to be cautiously optimistic about. It might be used for good, but could also used for evil. This could be highly addictive, and people with low self esteem would probably rush to use this as a replacement for actual human contact. Put two and two together and some in between, we find ourselves in a dystopic society almost like Blade Runner… Although it’s really cool and an absolutely mindblowing technology, it’s also something to be seen as a threat to real human connection.

text_Original: Is someone deleting comments here? Or am I the only one thinking critically about this? People don't realize that zuckerberg is planting seeds of ideas into your heads that are very likely to do nothing with what's good for you or us, but much more with making multi-billion dollar investment for one of the biggest publicly traded companies worth it. Please put down your rose-colored glasses. There is so much that's underneath what's discussed here. It's not about the technology, it's not about making our lives better. Did Facebook in the past bring joy into our lives or did they create this giant mess that we're still recovering from?
